If you TD your divisions, the germans will simply have no chance to cross the river, except if they have the air superiority and a large amount of CAS. This also works the other way, if you have the air superiority and good quantities of CAS, he will NOT pass the river. (also level 5 fort the smonlensk area since its the only passage without river).
Now, on one versus one, the germans will best you in air combat because of their sheer production capacity. There are two ways you can win against them :
First is that the allies actually do something and take off a hefty chunk of his airforce, and you are able to gain air superiority.
Second is they lend lease you aircraft instead and you fight him in the air, winning after a lot of losses.
In best scenario, they should both bomb germany and send you aircraft. If you are sure that allies won't do anything, then just build SPAA and try to upgrade their air attack with experience. They will help a lot.
What I'm trying to tell you here is when attacking river+forts, their ground units get a very large penalty. Their only way of damaging you is by air.
